title: New NBA mock draft, two days before Round 1: Latest buzz on the chaotic top-10 picks
content: Will the 76ers, Hornets and Jazz take best-player-available approaches? We project both rounds of the NBA draft.

title: Bilas: Eight prospects who stand out in this year's NBA draft class
content: From the no-brainer to the wild cards to those in between, here are eight prospects who caught Jay Bilas' eye.

title: Sources: Celtics trading Holiday to Trail Blazers
content: The Celtics are trading Jrue Holiday to the Trail Blazers for Anfernee Simons and two second-round draft picks, sources told ESPN on Monday night.

title: Haliburton on playing injured: 'I'd do it again'
content: Indiana Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton said he didn't regret playing through a calf strain that led to a torn right Achilles tendon in Game 7.

title: Tatis sues company to void future earnings deal
content: Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. filed a lawsuit Monday against Big League Advance in an attempt to void the future earnings contract he signed as a 17-year-old minor leaguer that could cost him $34 million.

title: Raleigh hits MLB-leading 32nd HR in Mariners' win
content: Seattle star catcher Cal Raleigh, 28, hit his major-league-leading 32nd home run in the ninth inning of the Mariners' 11-2 victory over the Minnesota Twins on Monday night, just a few hours after being chosen the American League player of the week.

title: Sources: Mavs to extend Gafford on $60M deal
content: Dallas Mavericks center Daniel Gafford intends to sign a three-year contract extension worth nearly $60 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Miami's unbeaten run sets up CWC clash with PSG
content: Palmeiras came from behind to draw 2-2 with host Inter Miami at Hard Rock Stadium on Monday night, with both clubs advancing to the Club World Cup round of 16 and setting up a matchup between Miami and Paris Saint-Germain.

title: D-backs' Carroll headed to IL with wrist fracture
content: Arizona Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo told reporters, after his club's 10-0 victory over the Chicago White Sox on Monday night, that star outfielder Corbin Carroll has a chip fracture in his left wrist, and the veteran is headed to the injured list.

title: 'We are Vegas' team': A's begin building stadium
content: The A's on Monday celebrated the groundbreaking of their new $1.75 billion, 33,000-person capacity ballpark in Las Vegas that is expected to be finished in time for the 2028 season.

title: Ranking the top 50 MLB trade deadline candidates -- and finding their best landing spots
content: More Red Sox stars on the move? A former Cy Young available? Here are the big names your team could be targeting.

title: How Cooper Flagg and the beleaguered Mavericks responded to a shocking NBA draft lottery
content: The presumptive No. 1 pick of the 2025 draft and the organization, still reeling from trading away Luka Doncic, might just be made for each other -- at exactly the right time.

title: Use the No. 3 pick, or trade for a vet? What we know about the 76ers going into the draft
content: While questions surround Joel Embiid's health and Paul George's status, we have two trade offers for the 76ers.

title: Buzz: How Blackhawks, Isles, Predators could shake up first round
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: Club World Cup Daily: Messi's Miami book showdown with PSG
content: Leo Messi's Inter Miami have made it to the knockouts, where they'll face PSG, while Atletico are the first big team to go home early. Here's what you need to know from Monday's Club World Cup action.

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Defending champion Florida returns to the top line
content: Florida benefited from the transfer portal -- and some key NBA draft withdrawals -- to get to the top line.

title: How close is your team to an NBA title? We tiered all 30 franchises
content: While the world watched the Finals, the league's hierarchy shifted. Is OKC already looking over its shoulder ?

title: Why this Thunder big 3 might be the one to start a dynasty
content: When the Thunder set out to build a champion, they learned hard lessons from how their historic trio of KD, Russell Westbrook and James Harden flamed out a decade ago.

title: Redrafting the top 10 picks in every MLB draft from 2015 to 2024
content: Witt over Rutschman? Does Skenes still go No. 1? Let's go back in time to right the wrongs of the past 10 MLB drafts.

title: What the Club World Cup can tell us about comparing MLS to the Premier League and more
content: How does MLS compare to the Premier League, the Bundesliga and beyond? The Club World Cup might be the best chance to find an answer.

title: Wrexham legend Paul Mullin leaves club on loan
content: Paul Mullin, the poster boy of a Wrexham team soaring through England's football leagues following their takeover by Hollywood celebrities, has left the club to join League One side Wigan on a season-long loan deal.

title: City's Lewis has CWC ban extended by 2 games
content: Rico Lewis will miss Manchester City's next two games at the Club World Cup after his ban was extended following his red card against Wydad AC.

title: Source: Barça close in on Roony Bardghji transfer
content: Barcelona are close to completing the signing of Copenhagen FC winger Roony Bardghji, a source has told ESPN.

title: Chelsea feel no pressure to win $130M CWC prize
content: Enzo Maresca said Chelsea are not under any financial pressure to lift the Club World Cup despite the £97million on offer to the winner.

title: Sources: Milan's Hernández nears Al Hilal move
content: Saudi Pro League club Al Hilal are in advanced negotiations with AC Milan to sign Theo Hernández for a fee close to €30 million ($34.6m), sources have told ESPN.

title: Poch awed by U.S. leader Tillman: 'What a player'
content: United States manager Mauricio Pochettino said he was pleased to see his team deliver a "professional performance" in defeating Haiti 2-1 in the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Jets owner Johnson agrees to buy Palace stake
content: New York Jets owner Woody Johnson has agreed on a £190 million deal ($254m) to buy a 43% stake in Premier League team Crystal Palace from American businessman John Textor, the club announced on Monday.

title: As U.S. battle without stars at Gold Cup, which fringe players are stepping up?
content: The U.S. has been without several stars at this summer's Gold Cup, so which fringe players have stepped up to fight for a place at next year's World Cup?

title: Grading the deal: Houston goes all-in, but did Phoenix get enough?
content: The Suns and Rockets have agreed to a deal that lands Kevin Durant in Houston. Which side won the trade?

title: Should you take Jeanty over Barkley in fantasy drafts?
content: Is the 2,000-yard back being undervalued? Or is regression coming for him and the hot rookie is the better choice?

title: Whitcomb, Amihere lead top pickups this week
content: Sami Whitcomb and Laeticia Amihere are positioned to produce for their teams and fantasy managers ahead of a busy week in the WNBA.

title: 'Reported Defects Reappearing On Aircraft': Aviation Watchdog After Audit
content: A special audit of airlines, maintenance teams and other aspects carried out by the aviation watchdog at airports like Delhi and Mumbai has revealed several deficiencies, including reported defects reappearing on aircraft.

title: Zelensky, Trump Set To Meet Wednesday On NATO Sidelines, Ukraine Confirms
content: Volodymyr Zelensky and US President Donald Trump are planning to meet on Wednesday on the sidelines of the NATO summit in The Hague, a senior source in the Ukrainian presidency told AFP.

title: Tirupati Laddoos Now Available At Easy-To-Use Kiosks For Pilgrims
content: The Tirupati laddoo that has a dedicated following of its own, even among those who may not identify themselves as devotees, is now available at kiosk machines set up at laddoos counters in Tirumala.

title: "All Planes Will Head Home": Trump, Unhappy With Israel, Dials Netanyahu
content: The ceasefire between Iran and Israel "is in effect" and Israel is not going to attack Iran, Donald Trump declared on Tuesday amid fears that the tenous ceasefire agreement between Iran and Israel will not hold.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Between Operations Gibraltar And Sindoor, A Missed Industrial Revolution
content: A look at some numbers to see how far India has travelled over the last sixty years, since Operation Gibraltar of 1965.

title: Trump Tells Israel 'Don't Drop Bombs,' Then Drops An F-Bomb
content: US President Donald Trump was clearly unhappy with Israel and Iran when he left the White House earlier today for the NATO summit at The Hague.

title: "1.4 Billion Hearts Beat For Indian Astronaut's Space Journey": Top Official
content: India's second astronaut, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, is poised to make history as he prepares to fly to the International Space Station aboard the Axiom-4 mission, also known as Mission Akash Ganga.

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: "All Planes Will Head Home": Trump, Unhappy With Israel, Dials Netanyahu
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: A series of powerful explosions rocked Tehran early Tuesday morning, hours after US President Donald Trump announced that Iran and Israel have agreed to a staggered ceasefire.

title: 5 Weapons Kept 'Secret' So Far Were Deployed By US During Iran Strikes
content: Five weapons, apart from the Tomahawk cruise missiles and the GBU-57 bunker-buster bombs, no one knew about till now, were also deployed by the US for its mission to strike Iran's three nuclear sites - Fordow, Natanz and Eshafan.

title: Taken Measures To Continue Nuclear Programme Post US-Israeli Strikes, Iran Says
content: Iran's government said Tuesday it had "taken the necessary measures" to ensure the continuation of its nuclear programme after US and Israeli strikes targeted its facilities.

title: Ready To Recommend Assembly Dissolution: Omar Abdullah On J&K Statehood
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Tuesday said he has no objections if the Legislative Assembly has to be dissolved and fresh elections are to be conducted after statehood is restored to Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Qatar Says Will Take 'Diplomatic And Legal' Action Against Iran After Attack On US Base
content: Qatar's prime minister said Tuesday Doha will pursue "diplomatic and legal measures" against Tehran following an Iranian attack on the US Al Udeid base hosted in the Gulf state.

title: Russia Rejects Charge It Did Little To Help Iran Amid Conflict With Israel
content: The Kremlin on Tuesday pushed back against criticism that it had not done enough to back Iran, saying it had taken a "clear position" by condemning U.S. and Israeli strikes on the Islamic Republic.

title: "Travesty Of Justice": Top Court Summons UP Jailor For Not Releasing Man Despite Bail
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said it was a "travesty of justice" that a man it granted bail to in April in a case under UP's anti-conversion law had not yet been released from jail.

title: Qatar PM Hopes Israel Won't Exploit Iran Truce To Keep Bombing Gaza
content: Mediator Qatar's said Tuesday it was working on resuming Gaza ceasefire talks in days, urging Israel not to exploit a truce with Iran to "unleash everything it wants to unleash" on the blockaded strip.

title: "Unlimited Scope Of Abuse": Meitei, Thadou Tribe Bodies Ask Centre To Remove 'Any Kuki Tribes' From Manipur ST List
content: Two top civil society organisations of Manipur's Meitei community and the indigenous distinct tribe Thadou have asked the central government to remove 'Any Kuki Tribes' from the list of Scheduled Tribes (ST) in Manipur.

title: Governments Should Take House Panels' Reports In Constructive Manner: Om Birla
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday said that governments should take the reports of parliamentary committees in a constructive manner and not as a criticism of their functioning.

title: 'Aggressor' To 'Peacemaker' In 2 Days: Trump And The Iran-Israel Thriller
content: Genius or Joker? Or the joker who changes fortunes in a card game. If the 12-day Israel-Iran conflict is a tale of surprises, its protagonist is none other than US President Donald Trump

title: Air India To Resume Flights To Middle East, Europe From Today
content: Air India, which halted its flights to several regions as Iran fired missiles at the United States' Al Udeid air base in Qatar on Monday, is resuming services to the Middle East and Europe starting Tuesday.

title: 3 Dead After Inhaling Poisonous Gas In Well In Madhya Pradesh's Guna
content: Three persons died due to suspected inhalation of poisonous gas in a well while trying to rescue a calf in Guna district of Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday, officials said.

title: 'Friendly plane wave': Israel defies Trump's ceasefire plan; launches missiles at Iran
content: Following a ceasefire agreement, tensions flared again between Israel and Iran, prompting US President Donald Trump to intervene. Trump assured that Israel would cease its attacks, claiming they would simply do a "Plane Wave" to Iran. Despite the ceasefire announcement, both sides accused each other of violations, with Israel citing Iranian missile fire.

title: 'Worn out tyres to faded runway line': DGCA audit report finds aviation lapses
content: A DGCA audit of India's aviation sector has revealed safety lapses, including worn aircraft tires, recurring defects due to ineffective repairs, and faded runway markings. The surveillance also found issues with ground handling equipment, maintenance procedures, and vehicles lacking speed governors. The DGCA has directed concerned operators to take corrective actions within seven days to address these critical findings.

title: Tensions flare at Headingley! Siraj loses his cool at England openers over time-wasting drama
content: The first session of the India versus England Test saw a tense moment. Zak Crawley delayed Mohammed Siraj's over, disrupting India's plan. England's openers, Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley, batted strongly. They forged an unbeaten 117-run partnership. Bumrah missed a catch. England reached lunch at 117/0, needing 254 more runs. The match hangs in the balance with all results possible.

title: New US Visa rule: Visa applicants to change this setting on FB, Instagram
content: The US embassy in India has announced that applicants for F, M, and J non-immigrant visas must now make their social media accounts public. This new guideline aims to help U.S. officials verify the identity and eligibility of visa applicants during the security screening process. The embassy stated this change is necessary to facilitate vetting and establish admissibility under U.S.

title: Jammu-Srinagar tunnel: All-weather route for troops, convoys on the cards
content: In Jammu and Kashmir, the Centre is reconsidering financial approvals for the Singhpora-Vailoo and Sudhmahadev-Dranga tunnel projects to enhance year-round connectivity. These projects aim to establish a safer alternative to the Jammu-Srinagar NH 44. Additionally, the Peer Ki Gali tunnel on the Mughal Road is part of a broader initiative to provide crucial all-weather routes.

title: Truce violation: Trump says 'really unhappy with Israel, not happy with Iran either'
content: Donald Trump has criticized both Israel and Iran for allegedly violating the recent ceasefire agreement. He specifically disapproved of Israel's immediate response following the truce, referencing reported airstrikes after a missile launch from Iran. While acknowledging the violations, Trump remains uncertain if the ceasefire is entirely broken.

title: WATCH | 'Ek taraf se Mohammad, ek taraf se Krishna': Gill's rally cry
content: Shubman Gill motivated Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna on Day 5 of the first Test. England chased 371 runs, reaching 117 at lunch without losing a wicket. Gill's remark about the bowlers was caught on the stump mic. Teams observed silence for Dilip Doshi's passing. England needed 254 more runs with all wickets in hand to win the match.

title: Security Risk: US House staff told to delete WhatsApp; Zuckerberg’s app flagged as…
content: The US House of Representatives has banned WhatsApp on government-managed devices due to cybersecurity risks, citing a lack of data encryption and transparency. The directive from the Chief Administrative Officer urges staff to uninstall WhatsApp and recommends alternative platforms like Signal and Microsoft Teams. Meta disputes the ban, emphasizing WhatsApp's end-to-end encryption and security measures.

title: SCO summit in China: Ajit Doval urges nations to 'shun double standards against terrorism'; pitches for 'joint information operation'
content: NSA Ajit Doval addressed the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation, urging members to abandon double standards in combating terrorism and hold accountable those responsible for cross-border attacks. He highlighted India's concern over UN-proscribed terror groups and advocated for a joint information operation to counter terrorism, separatism, and extremism within the SCO framework.

title: Air India to resume Middle East, Europe flights; US, Canada operations next
content: Air India announced the gradual resumption of flights to West Asia as airspace reopens in the conflict-hit region, with most Middle East operations restarting from June 25. Flights to and from Europe are being reinstated, while services to the US East Coast and Canada will resume soon. The airline is committed to minimising disruptions and avoiding unsafe airspaces.

title: Tata Harrier EV RWD vs Hyundai Creta EV: Price, variants, specs compared
content: Talking about the range, the Harrier EV’s 75kWh RWD and AWD versions offer an MIDC-certified range of up to 627km and 622km, respectively, on a full charge. Talking about the charging, the SUV takes approximately 10.7 hours to go from 10 to 100 per cent using a 7.2kW AC charger, while a 120kW DC fast charger can top up the battery from 20 to 80 per cent in just 25 minutes (both claimed).

title: How Bill Gates reacted 'very differently' when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: Udaipur shocker: French tourist sexually assaulted; FIR filed, accused flees
content: In Udaipur's Tiger Hill area, a French tourist reported a sexual assault after visiting a local café. Following a visit to The Greek Farm café, the victim allegedly left with a man named Siddharth, who is accused of taking her to his room and committing the assault.

title: 'Virat Kohli felt it was time to go': Sourav Ganguly drops bombshell on his shocking Test retirement
content: Sourav Ganguly confirmed Virat Kohli's Test retirement was his own decision, despite BCCI's attempts to persuade him otherwise. Ganguly acknowledged Kohli's choice, drawing parallels to his own retirement, emphasizing that every player understands their standing. While surprised by Kohli's relatively early departure at 36, Ganguly believes Kohli felt it was the right time, similar to his own exit.

title: 'They are not Bangladeshis': Mamata says Bengal migrants wrongfully held
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee claims Bengali workers are wrongly identified as Bangladeshis and deported. She accuses the BJP of language-based politics. Banerjee says her government has rescued some workers. Recent crackdowns in Delhi saw the arrest of suspected illegal immigrants. Banerjee previously accused the BSF of aiding infiltration.

title: Watch: Fire erupts in Moscow apartment after Ukrainian drone strike
content: A Ukrainian drone strike ignited a fire in a multi-storey building in Krasnogorsk, Moscow, injuring two and prompting the evacuation of over 100 residents, including 30 children. Russia's defence ministry reported destroying 20 Ukrainian drones across six regions, leading to temporary flight suspensions at Moscow's Vnukovo and Sheremetyevo airports.

title: Bold statement! 'Rishabh Pant could break Rahul Dravid's record'
content: Rishabh Pant's twin centuries in the Leeds Test have sparked discussions about his potential to surpass Rahul Dravid's record for most Test centuries by an Indian in England. Sanjay Manjrekar highlighted Pant's unique position as a wicketkeeper-batter, praising his adaptability and aggressive yet measured approach.

title: Dwyane Wade’s daughter steals spotlight dancing in white lehanga
content: A delightful Instagram video of Kaavia James, daughter of Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union, has captured hearts globally. The six-year-old is seen joyfully dancing to the Bollywood hit “What Jhumka?” while dressed in a traditional white lehenga. The heartwarming clip, posted by her parents, celebrates cultural exploration and youthful exuberance.

title: 'Vote theft': Rahul Gandhi alleges voter list manipulation in Fadnavis' constituency
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused Devendra Fadnavis' constituency of voter list irregularities, alleging an eight per cent increase in five months and unauthorized voting. Gandhi shared a news article on X, calling for the release of digital voter rolls and CCTV footage. He claims the Election Commission is silent or complicit, labeling the situation as "vote theft".

title: 'She’s heartbroken': Blake Lively breaks down as Taylor Swift cuts ties
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has ended. Sources say Lively is heartbroken after Swift cut ties. Legal issues involving Justin Baldoni's case add complexity. Lively must submit texts with Swift. Rumors suggest Lively tried to leverage her Swift connection. Travis Kelce supports Swift during this difficult time. Swift's upcoming album may reflect themes of betrayal.

title: Rashtrapati Bhavan: Siddaramaiah-Aamir Khan candid pics go viral
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Bollywood actor Aamir Khan exchanged warm greetings at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Tuesday, capturing the internet's attention. The spontaneous interaction was described as friendly, with both exchanging best wishes. Siddaramaiah is in Delhi for official engagements, including a meeting with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Black box of crashed AI plane not sent abroad, says Naidu; currently with AIIB
content: Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu refuted media reports claiming the Air India Ahmedabad crash black box was sent abroad. He confirmed the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is analyzing it in India. The London-bound Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crashed on June 12, killing 241, and the government formed a panel to investigate the cause.

title: US strike on Iran: Mystery deepens over missing uranium stockpile; buried or moved?
content: Satellite images and Israeli intelligence suggest Iran moved near-weapons-grade uranium before US airstrikes on its nuclear facilities. The missing fuel, enough for multiple bombs, raises concerns despite claims of program obliteration. While the strikes caused significant damage, the location of the enriched uranium remains unknown, hindering diplomatic efforts and potentially delaying Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: 'All polls held as per law': EC rebuts Rahul; LoP repeats 'voter theft' charge
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) refuted Rahul Gandhi's rigging allegations in the 2024 Maharashtra polls, asserting adherence to established electoral laws and processes. Despite ECI's clarification and invitation for further discussion, Gandhi persisted with his claims of irregularities, particularly highlighting significant voter list increases in certain constituencies and demanding the release of digital voter rolls and CCTV footage.

title: ITR filing last date extended: Will penal interest be charged after July 31? What experts say
content: The ITR filing deadline for FY 2024-25 has been extended to September 15, 2025, potentially waiving penal interest under Section 234A if self-assessment tax is paid by the extended date. However, this extension does not affect penal interest applicability under Sections 234B and 234C for advance tax deficiencies, which remain in effect.

title: TCS plans big Rs 4,500 crore push: New campuses, office spaces & more
content: Tata Consultancy Services is investing heavily in expansion. New campuses and office spaces are planned across India. Bengaluru, Kolkata, and Kochi are key locations. The company aims to boost delivery capacity. This move signals confidence in India's tech talent. TCS reported strong financial results for FY25. Headcount also increased with new hires and promotions.

title: Peace in Our Timeline? How Trump keeps declaring ceasefires — and craving credit
content: Because in Trump’s world, peace isn’t negotiated—it’s declared. Ceasefires aren’t forged in backrooms or brokered by diplomats. They’re conjured on​Truth Social and announced as if the world runs on vibes. It’s not diplomacy. It’s delusion dressed in digital drag.

title: Diplomatic deja vu: Trump pulls off an India-Pakistan on Israel-Iran; ceasefire 'in effect'
content: US President Donald Trump unilaterally declared a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, a move that surprised even his own administration and the involved nations. Trump claimed both countries sought his intervention for peace. He outlined a detailed ceasefire plan on social media, complete with a timeline, despite ongoing missile exchanges.

title: IND vs ENG: Why are India, England players wearing black armbands? Full details
content: Indian and England cricket players wore black armbands on Day 5 of the first Test at Headingley to pay tribute to Dilip Doshi, the former Indian spinner. Doshi, who passed away at the age of 77 in London due to a cardiac arrest, was remembered for his determination and contributions to Indian cricket despite playing alongside Bishan Singh Bedi.

title: 8-hour ordeal: Leaky Vande Bharat train roof leaves student drenched; staff say ‘adjust kariye’
content: Darshil Mishra's Vande Bharat Express journey from Varanasi to Delhi turned disastrous when the train's roof leaked, drenching him and fellow passengers. The onboard staff's dismissive response and the TTE's absence compounded the issue, forcing passengers to endure a humid and uncomfortable ride. The incident, captured on video, sparked outrage online, prompting calls for accountability and improved maintenance.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ collection: Aamir's movie nears Rs 70 cr; sees slight dip
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' experienced a strong opening weekend, exceeding expectations despite being a niche film. The movie witnessed substantial growth on Saturday and Sunday, but faced a significant drop on Monday and Tuesday. While performing well in multiplexes and certain territories, its fate hinges on maintaining momentum throughout the week, especially with the upcoming release of 'Maa'.

title: ‘Love triangle or money plot?': Raja's kin seeks narco test on Sonam, lover Raj; brother moves HC
content: Following the murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi during his honeymoon in Meghalaya, his family intends to petition the Meghalaya High Court for narco-analysis tests on his wife, Sonam, and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha. The family hopes the tests will reveal the unclear motive behind the murder, suspecting financial gain beyond the alleged love triangle.

title: 'You have 12 hours to...': Did Israeli agents warn Iranian generals before strike?
content: Following Israeli airstrikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites, intelligence agents initiated a covert intimidation campaign targeting top Iranian officials. The operation, dubbed "Rising Lion," involved chilling phone calls threatening Iranian generals to defect or face death. This campaign aimed to destabilize Iran's command structure after the elimination of key leaders, creating fear among potential successors.

title: Watch: Chaos erupts at music festival in Paris after mysterious syringe attacks
content: French authorities arrested twelve individuals accused of syringe attacks at a nationwide music festival, with approximately 145 people reporting needle pricks across the country, including 13 in Paris. Investigations are underway to determine if the syringes contained date rape drugs.

title: Adani Group to put $15-20 bn across businesses over 5 years
content: Gautam Adani announced a $15-20 billion investment plan over the next five years, aiming to fuel the Adani Group's growth across its diverse infrastructure portfolio.

title: No Royal roles for Harry-Meghan Markle’s children, reveal Palace insiders
content: Prince William, the future King, reportedly intends to exclude Prince Harry's children, Archie and Lilibet, from formal royal duties, furthering the family rift. Sources indicate William is focused on a streamlined monarchy, leaving Archie and Lilibet as 'outcasts'.

title: Indian Railways hikes fares of trains; minor increase in ticket prices from July 1
content: Indian Railways is set to hike passenger train fares for the first time in several years. The minor increase in fares will be effective from July 1, 2025. Earlier this month, Indian Railways made a significant announcement requiring Aadhaar authentication for tatkal train ticket bookings.

title: Ram Kapoor excluded from the promotions of Mistry after inappropriate remarks: Report
content: During promotions for the show 'Mistry,' actor Ram Kapoor faced backlash for making sexually inappropriate and offensive remarks towards the crew, including comments about kissing a male executive, his mother, and a female crew member's outfit. Following complaints and corroboration, the actor was removed from further promotional activities, with Mona Singh conducting solo interviews.

title: 'Mahi bhaiya...': MS Dhoni playing with a former teammates' son - Watch
content: Former India cricketer Saurabh Tiwary shared a heartwarming video on Facebook featuring MS Dhoni playfully interacting with his son, Sourish, in a gym. Tiwary, who debuted for India under Dhoni in 2010, recently transitioned to administration, being elected as secretary and joint secretary of the Jharkhand State Cricket Association after retiring from professional cricket last year.

title: Gulf tensions: Multiple flights disrupted across India; airlines issue alert
content: Flight operations at Delhi's IGI Airport faced major disruptions with 48 cancellations, impacting Air India and IndiGo significantly. Airports across India, including Ahmedabad, Thiruvananthapuram, and Mangaluru, experienced delays due to airspace restrictions over Qatar and the Gulf region. Cochin and Lucknow airports issued advisories amid heightened Middle East tensions following Iran's missile strike on U.S. bases in Qatar and Iraq.

title: Stock market rally: Investors richer by Rs 5 lakh crore - top reasons
content: Stock market today: The Nifty 50 concluded at 25,044.35, increasing by 72.45 points or 0.29 per cent, retreating from its day's peak of 25,317.70. The 30-share Sensex, which had advanced 1,121.37 points or 1.36 per cent to 83,018.16 during trading, pared gains following reports of ceasefire complications.

title: Will PPF rate fall below 7%? Public Provident Fund rate could hit 50-year low
content: Will Public Provident Fund (PPF) rate fall below 7% for the first time in decades, influenced by the Gopinath Committee formula and fluctuating 10-year government bond yields? Despite the possibility of a rate cut, PPF remains an attractive investment due to its tax-free interest, especially compared to taxable bank deposits and capped Voluntary Provident Fund contributions.

title: IND vs ENG: Ashwin comments on Jaiswal's catching; wants Jadeja to step up
content: R. Ashwin defended Yashasvi Jaiswal's slip catching in England, citing the Dukes ball's difficulty and urging patience. He highlighted the ball's larger feel compared to SG and Kookaburra. Ashwin also suggested Indian pacers create rough patches for Ravindra Jadeja to exploit, drawing inspiration from how foreign teams aid their spinners. He emphasized the importance of spin for India's chances.

title: BJP alleges Rahul Gandhi on 'secret' foreign trip; Congress hits back
content: The Congress party defended Rahul Gandhi's trip to London for his niece's graduation after BJP's Amit Malviya criticized his frequent foreign travels and demanded transparency. Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera accused the PMO of dirty tricks, confirming Gandhi's attendance at Miraya Vadra's graduation.

title: FWICE calls for boycott of Diljit Dosanjh,'Sardaarji 3' makers; urge PM Modi for action
content: The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) has strongly condemned Diljit Dosanjh and the makers of ‘Sardaarji 3’ for casting Pakistani actress Hania Aamir, alleging she is 'anti-India'. FWICE has appealed to PM Modi for immediate action, urging a ban on the film's release in India and demanding the revocation of the filmmakers' passports.

title: Raj dig uncovers 3,500-yr-old site: ASI traces riverbed; findings link it to Saraswati river
content: In the heart of Rajasthan's Deeg district, archaeologists from the ASI have stumbled upon an ancient palaeochannel that may connect to the legendary Saraswati river. Recent excavations in Bahaj village have revealed settlements dating back to 3500-1000 BC, showcasing relics from the Kushan, Magadha, and Sunga dynasties.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Norman closing in on top spot at welterweight
content: Brian Norman Jr. earned his third consecutive KO win to retain the WBO welterweight title. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 2025-26 NBA championship odds: Thunder open as faves ahead of Cavs, Knicks
content: Fresh off their first NBA championship, the Oklahoma City Thunder are favorites to repeat next season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Casemiro to join Ronaldo at Al Nassr?
content: Manchester United midfielder Casemiro could be reunited with Cristiano Ronaldo at Al Nassr. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Waiver wire: Find someone like Jo Adell?
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire. Rumor has it you should be looking at the Angels outfield.

title: 11,500 cusecs of water released to boost Kharif operations in Godavari delta
content: Paddy farmers have intensified direct sowing and nursery activities marking the beginning of the Kharif season 2025-26 in the Godavari region

title: Thrissur becomes first district to convert tribal settlements with individual forest rights into revenue villages
content: Collector hands over notification declaring Kakkinikkad settlement in Thekkumkara panchayat as a revenue village to the Oorumooppan. 36 forest villages across Talappilly, Thrissur, and Chalakudy taluks have been granted individual forest rights

title: Unaccounted cash row: Parliamentary panel asks why no FIR against Justice Varma
content: During a meeting of the Parliamentary Committee on Personnel, Public Grievances, Law and Justice, MPs of various parties raised the issue and posed several questions to the Ministry of Law and Justice on what it was doing in the matters raised concerning the judiciary

title: Karnataka Housing Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan says he will order a probe into allegations of corruption in allotment of houses
content: ‘I am not a poor man who survives by taking bribe for sanctioning houses meant for underprivileged sections’, says Housing Minister

title: Free Sparsha Darshan to resume at Srisailam temple from July 1
content: The facility will be available for two hours— 1.45 p.m. to 3.45 p.m.—on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays, says temple Executive Officer

title: French woman raped in Udaipur, police looking for accused
content: “The woman is allegedly in a stable condition and is undergoing treatment at a private hospital,” Station House Officer added

title: Giving wings to Wayanad’s airstrip dreams, feasibility study to get under way
content: Inability to identify a suitable piece of land, at least 1,800 m in length, in the hilly district remains one of the major hurdles. KIIFCON-RITES is conducting study in Idukki and Kasaragod districts as well

title: Sanction letters issued to 2.37 lakh beneficiaries out of 3 lakh target under Indiramma Housing scheme: Telangana Revenue Minister
content: The target for this year is 4.5 lakh houses involving ₹22,500 crore. The govt also decided to provide ₹5 lakh in respect of incomplete 2BHK houses

title: Rare to see such a large economy growing so fast: Walmart CEO on India
content: “If you could see that from the many years that we’ve been here and you could expect that to continue, we see the growth in India,” Mr. McMillon said

title: Novo Nordisk launches Wegovy in India for weight management, cardiovascular risk reduction
content: Wegovy® offers a clinically proven option for sustained weight loss while also helping reduce the risk of serious cardiovascular events in individuals with obesity

title: Actor Meenakshi Jayan on her award-winning performance in ‘Victoria’: I can place myself on big stages
content: She won the best actress award for her performance in the Sivaranjini-directorial, playing a beautician from Angamaly

title: Plan infrastructure that minimises impact on native wildlife in Nilgiris, urge ecologists
content: The carcass of an Indian giant flying squirrel was found in April 2023, entangled in barbed wire fencing along the roadside near a private property.

title: Drunk taxi driver rams car, killing pregnant woman and her father in Chennai
content: Chromepet Traffic Investigation police, during investigation, found that driver Manikandan was drunk and had driven the car in the opposite direction for more than 10 km. He has been arrested.

title: Cancer patient abandoned in Mumbai’s Aarey; National Cancer Institute volunteers to treat her
content: National Cancer Institute in Nagpur steps up to treat abandoned elderly cancer patient from Mumbai’s Aarey area

title: Indian Air Force to get at least 6 Tejas jets by March: HAL chief Sunil
content: HAL Chairman and MD D.K. Sunil said the delay was caused only due to the U.S. firm’s inability to supply the F404 engines on time

title: Kerala backs off from enacting black magic law, cites policy decision in High Court
content: In an affidavit, Kerala government submits that while the court may have noted the social concerns raised in PIL, it cannot compel the legislature to pass a law

title: Madras High Court orders notices to five IAS officers and a Joint Commissioner of HR&CE dept. in contempt plea
content: Chief Justice K.R. Shriram and Justice Sunder Mohan say, a prima facie case of contempt has been made out against the officials

title: Israel-Iran conflict | 18 flights cancelled at Hyderabad airport after airspace closure in Qatar
content: Later on Tuesday, Qatar Airways confirmed reinstatement of flights as airspace reopened in the country

title: Telangana govt integrating AI into TG-iPASS industrial system to enhance transparency, speed of approval
content: The State IT and Industries Minister mentions this to visiting French delegation, urging its members to explore growth opportunities in Telangana’s ambitious Future City project

title: PM Modi's 'silence' on Israel's 'genocide' in Gaza has diminished India's moral, political standing: Congress
content: Congress criticises PM Modi’s silence on Israel’s Gaza ‘genocide’, urging India to speak out against the devastation in West Asia

title: DG Intelligence Shivdhar Reddy receives award on behalf of Telangana police for VeriFast app
content: The award was presented in New Delhi by Minister of State for External Affairs, Pabitra Margherita on the occasion of Passport Seva Divas

title: All polls held as per law: ECI tells Rahul Gandhi on Maharashtra poll rigging allegations
content: It also emphasised that the entire poll exercise involves thousands of personnel, including booth-level agents appointed by political parties.

title: Ahead of local body polls, Jana Sena puts special focus on north Andhra districts
content: The party is hopeful that it would get a sufficient number of ZPTC and MPTC seats in future although it was given only two Assembly seats in the general elections.

title: Tribal Ministry urged to delete 'Any Kuki Tribes' category from Manipur's ST list
content: ‘The vague nature of ‘Any Kuki tribes’ allows foreigners to claim tribal rights in Manipur, which poses a serious threat to land, resources, and constitutional privileges of pre-existing scheduled tribes,’ says Meitei Alliance

title: BJP demands Karnataka CM’s resignation over corruption charges by Congress MLAs
content: BJP State president B. Y. Vijayendra terms this as ‘State-sponsored corruption’ and demands that Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot intervene if CM does not quit

title: Search operation underway in Jammu and Kashmir’s Poonch
content: Security forces conduct search operation in Jammu and Kashmir’s Poonch district following suspicious movement, covering multiple areas

content: He hinted at the AIADMK having severed ties with the BJP in the past when similar defamatory statements were made against leaders of Dravidian parties

title: Nilambur bypoll: IUML leader M.K. Muneer says never had any pact with Jamaat or Welfare Party of India
content: Muneer says IUML and Jamaat ‘would not get along well with each other because of their ideological differences’

title: U.P. govt. to give ₹30 lakh each to families of two sanitation workers who died inhaling toxic gas
content: The U.P. government compensation is announced based on the minimum amount mandated by the Supreme Court

title: Search for two more persons resumes after landslip hits Yamunotri trek route in Uttarakhand
content: Search and rescue operations resume after landslip near Kainchi Bhairav Mandir, with one rescued and two bodies recovered; Gangotri Dham yatra halted temporarily

title: Defence Ministry clears ₹2,000 crore contracts under emergency procurement for counter-terror operations
content: The procurement aims to enhance situational awareness, lethality, mobility, and protection for troops deployed in CT environments

title: Marathi language being 'insulted': Sanjay Raut on govt meetings over 3-language policy
content: Sanjay Raut also questioned the "silence" of prominent Marathi literary figures and celebrities, and claimed many of them were not vocal on the issue due to their association with the government

title: Why the Anna University sexual assault case must be a wake-up call on women safety | Explained
content: What was the convict’s modus operandi? How did the women helpline 181 respond? Were the police sensitive enough? Did the court accept the claim of alibi?

title: 61-year-old Kerala doctor arrested in POCSO case for allegedly molesting teen during counselling
content: The incident occurred in December 2023 when the girl, now 16, visited the doctor’s house for counselling with her parents. She disclosed the abuse during a school counselling session this year

title: At SCO Defence Ministers’ meet in Qingdao, Rajnath likely to discuss regional peace, anti-terror cooperation
content: Rajnath Singh will hold bilateral meetings with the Defence Ministers of some participating countries, including China and Russia, on the sidelines of the meeting.

title: Student enrollment drop in Kota: Local economy struggles, coaching marketing intensifies
content: Kota’s student enrolments decline, impacting local businesses and prompting desperate marketing strategies.

title: India evacuates fresh batch of 292 Indians from Iran
content: A C-17 military transport aircraft of the Indian Air Force evacuated 165 Indians who were living in Israel. They were received at the airport by Union Minister L Murugan.

title: Telangana tops India in child labour rescues, arrests: Report
content: The report “Building the Case for Zero” calls for district-level child labour task forces, universal free and compulsory education up to the age of 18, and a zero-tolerance policy for the use of child labour in public procurement and supply chains

title: V.S. Achuthanandan remains in ICU, condition stable, says family
content: In a Facebook post, Achuthanandan’s son, V. Arun Kumar, says his father was admitted to the hospital on Monday after the centenarian experienced ‘mild’ breathing difficulties

title: West Asia tensions disrupt flights from Kannur airport in Kerala, Gulf-bound passengers hit
content: Passengers are advised to check the latest status of their flights with their respective airlines before proceeding to the airport, says Kannur International Airport Limited

title: Kerala High Court dismisses petitions against Kerala Clinical Establishments Act
content: Court rules that nothing in the Act seemed arbitrary or a violation of the Constitution, as the Act clearly gives opportunities for the clinical establishments for a hearing before the authorities can take dire steps against a clinical establishment

title: No fund crunch but bureaucratic delay, says Union Minister Gadkari on execution of big projects
content: During an event in Pune, Mr. Gadkari heaped praise on former bureaucrat Vijay Kelkar for his ‘flexibility in policy-making’

title: Keralites in West Asia share their anxiety
content: Keralites share their experiences during Iranian missile attack in Qatar and Bahrain, causing panic and evacuations

title: Linguist calls for cultural unity among speakers of Dravidian languages
content: Linguist Ganesh Devy emphasised the need for unity among the Dravidian language-speaking States of the south to launch a collective resistance against Hindi imposition

title: Meghalaya BJP leader seeks viewpoint named after Raja Raghuvanshi
content: James Syiemiong says the memorial for the slain Indore businessmen would be a symbolic landmark for tourism and awareness in Sohra

title: Lobbying begins as date notified for mayoral polls in Hubballi-Dharwad
content: The stage is set for electing a new mayor and a deputy mayor with the Regional Commissioner fixing June 30 as the date for elections

title: We will look into concerns expressed by Congress MLAs on lack of funds for development and corruption, says Karnataka Home Minister
content: Responding to the allegation by Aland MLA B. R. Patil about corruption in allocation of houses, the Home Minister said that the government would order an inquiry if specific allegations are made

title: Exploited in Saudi Arabia, Dharmavaram man returns home
content: Having undergone severe mental duress, Mr. Farooq made a call to Dharmavaram Assembly constituency in-charge Harish Babu, who brought the issue to the attention of the Minister.

title: Police cannot barge into house of history sheeters at night for surveillance, says Kerala HC
content: “Every man’s house is his castle or temple, the sanctity of which cannot be vilified by knocking on the door at odd hours”

title: Karnataka Lokayukta conducts raids across state, including BBMP and multiple town municipalities
content: The locations being raided are in Bengaluru, Shivamogga, Chikkamagaluru, Anekal, Gadag, Dharwad and Kalaburagi.

title: Himachal Pradesh government school teacher arrested under POCSO Act for allegedly sexually harassing 24 students
content: The mathematics teacher has been remanded in police custody for three days and suspended from service, they said.

title: Rights activists take exceptions to bail condition of cleaning police station in Odisha
content: ‘We are afraid, if such bail conditions become a judicial precedence, it will adversely affect the principle of right to bail,’ says Biswapriya Kanungo, a human right lawyer

title: Jagan Mohan Reddy blames convoy death on lack of Z-plus security cover
content: Despite having informed officials in advance about Rentapalla tour, standard security protocols were ignored, alleges the YSRCP president

title: Jagan was provided Z-plus security during Rentapalla tour, says A.P. Home Minister
content: The convoy death case is being dealt with as per law, and those responsible for it will be punished, says Anitha.

title: Four BJP MLAs suspended from West Bengal Assembly
content: They were suspended from the House due to disobedience towards the Speaker, for allegedly hitting microphones, and misconduct.

title: Delhi Police bust racket of illegal diversion of aviation turbine fuel
content: According to Delhi police, the security locks on the tankers that were meant to be opened only at the designated airport depot were then bypassed using a duplicate master key.

title: Heavy rains trigger landslide on Mata Vaishno Devi track; forces suspension of battery car service
content: The officials said the pilgrimage was diverted to the old route and was continuing without any disruption.

title: Despite letter from Union Ministry, DSEL yet to act against private school that allegedly denied admission to child suffering from ‘mild hyperactivity’
content: The management claimed that the school had not denied admission to the student, but rather the father had moved the child to another school

title: NAL transfers environment-friendly solar absorber coating technology to Mysuru startup
content: NALSUN-NG requires minimal investment in infrastructure, has no flammable components, and poses no effluent treatment challenges making it ideal for local manufacturing and rural deployment

title: Kerala Opposition Leader seeks Centre’s intervention to ensure safety of Indians in Qatar
content: In letter to PM, V.D. Satheesan says a large number of Indian expatriates, particularly from Kerala, work across the Gulf countries

title: Three killed, 10 injured as lorry rams commuters at Lankelapalem Junction in Vizag
content: According to a police official, the lorry was heading towards Anakapalli from Gajuwaka, when it reportedly rammed into multiple vehicles at the busy junction.

title: Closure of airspaces: Passengers endure long ordeal at Kochi airport in Kerala amid flight disruptions
content: As of Tuesday morning, 17 services to and from Kochi airport stand cancelled. This includes services to Doha, Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Muscat, Ras al-Khaimah, Bahrain, Dammam, and Kuwait

title: India enters top 100 in global Sustainable Development Goals rankings for first time
content: India ranks 99th on the 2025 SDG Index with a score of 67, while China ranks 49th with 74.4 and the US 44th with 75.2 points.

title: Flight disruptions in Kerala to continue though airspaces in West Asia reopened
content: Additional seating arrangements for passengers and counters for airlines are being set up in Terminal 2 of the Thiruvananthapuram International Airport to handle the situation

title: Eluru man becomes Andhra Pradesh’s first para-swimmer to conquer English Channel, Palk Strait
content: Balaga Ganesh (38) was part of the ‘Pride of India – A Team’, a six-member relay team that successfully swam across the English Channel, covering a distance of 34 km from England to France in the Atlantic Ocean on June 16.

title: Indrakeeladri temple development gains momentum; master plan, land protection in focus
content: Efforts under way to secure Central support under the PRASAD scheme to boost Sri Kanaka Durga temple tourism infrastructure, says Endowments Minister

title: Ward Secretariat staff submit representations to Collector over promotions and transfers
content: Many employees in Ward Secretariats, who have completed five years of service and are eligible for promotion, have not been promoted so far, pointed out Subhani, who has completed six years of service.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: 16 flights cancelled to and from Bengaluru, five diverted
content: Airport sources said that the flights that were diverted to KIA departed after air space opened at 3 am.

title: Cheryl Miller, Russell Wilson, Azzi Fudd headline sightings at WNBA games this week
content: the celebrity rows at WNBA games have continued to pop off this season . on Juneteenth, the reigning national champion UConn Huskies women's basketball team made the trip down from Storrs to support former teammate Paige Bueckers .

title: Which Finals stars made our top five?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder have been crowned NBA champions for the first time since arriving in the Sooner State 17 years ago . the NHL handles its postseason honors that way, with the Conn Smythe Trophy awarded to the player with the best overall postseason . we set out to fill that gap with our five-player MVP ballot .

title: LSU wears crown as college baseball's premier program
content: the LSU Tigers beat Coastal Carolina with a big double play to take home the men's college world series . the title they really won was that of Greatest Ever College Baseball Program . "when we go to work every day, we do it trying to make the Tigers that came before us proud," says a designated hitter .

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, reports
content: Shams Charania tells pat McAfee he hasn't heard any rumors around LaMelo Ball . the Hornets shouldn't discount moving him if a massive offer comes along . teams around the league are keeping an eye on former MVP Giannis Antetokounmpo and his future with the Milwaukee Bucks .

title: Fantasy: How Haliburton's injury impacts Pacers
content: the Pacers could see the biggest shift in fantasy value for 2025-26 . in eight games without Haliburton this past season, Nembhard averaged 11.3 points, 2.6 rebounds and 6.6 assists . his 28.9 minutes per game in 2024-25 was a career high for the third-year pro out of Gonzaga .

title: Final draft rankings: Schaefer, Misa, Hagens, then...?
content: the top 64 are ranked here, along with details of their game, areas for development, perception among NHL scouts and an NHL projection . some players grade at higher or lower value than in previous rankings, but their position considers how likely they are to become NHL players based on their developmental needs and perception .

title: Why empty seats litter Club World Cup, Gold Cup
content: the club world cup is supposed to be the summer of soccer in the united states . the club is a warmup act for the 2026 FIFA World Cup in the u.s., canada and mexico . fans are struggling to back the tournament as attendances remain relatively low . three world cup hosts face off in their final competitive matches .

title: Delap: Cole Palmer convinced me to join Chelsea
content: Cole Palmer helped convince him to join the club this summer . the 22-year-old attracted interest from a host of clubs including manchester united , Nottingham Forest and Newcastle . delap and Palmer played in the same youth team at Manchester City in 2020-21 .

title: First-team reps? Big plays? A sneak peek at how the 2025 NFL draft first-rounders look
